edu.nyu.cs.javagit.client

Interface IGitAdd

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CliGitAdd

    public interface IGitAdd
    An interface to represent the git-add command.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.io.File file)
      Adds a file to the index with no options set.
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitAddOptions options, java.io.File file)
      Adds a file to the index.
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitAddOptions options, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      Adds list of files to the index.
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      Adds list of files to the index with no options set.
      GitAddResponse addDryRun(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      Dry run for adding a list of files to the index.
      GitAddResponse addVerbose(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      Adds list of files to the index in verbose mode.
      GitAddResponse addWithForce(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      Adds list of files to the index with Force option set.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                 GitAddOptions options,
                 java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                   throws JavaGitException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Adds list of files to the index.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - File path pointing to the root of the repository
        options - Object containing all the options that need to be passed to <git-add> command.
        paths - List of file paths that are going to be added to the index.
        Returns:
        GitAddResponse object.
        Throws:
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error while running the add command.
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • access to a file is denied
        • a command is not found on the PATH
